rows.name: Development Experience and Knowledge
cells: Some experience in documentation
At least 1 year of relevant documentation experience
At least 3 years of relevant documentation experience, including skills to design documents.
At least 5 years of relevant documentation experience, including skills to design documents and information design.
At least 7 years of relevant documentation experience, including skills to design documents and information design, and ability to coach and train other technical writers.

rows.name: Software Process Knowledge
cells: Not expected to have knowledge or experience of the documentation processes
Expected to be able to follow a defined documentation process
Expected to be able to follow and understand a defined documentation process
Expected to be able to follow, understand, and enhance a defined documentation process
Expected to be able to follow, understand and actively influence and enhance a defined documentation process

rows.name: Design and Documentation Skills
cells: Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation. Able to write documentation when the structure is provided.
Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation. Able to write simple documentation from start to finish
Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation. Able to create documentation structure and write a whole document.
Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation. Able to design complex document systems.
Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation. Able to design complex document systems.

rows.name: Job Titles
cells: Junior Technical Writer
Technical Writer
Senior Technical Writer
Lead Technical Writer
Chief Technical Writer

rows.name: Roles Played on a Project
cells: Plays the technical writer role
Plays the technical writer role
Plays the role of a key technical writer or a team leader of 2-5 technical writers
Plays the key technical writer and information designer roles, and usually also performs a team leader, reviewer and/or editor role
Can play any role, typically a senior position. Responsibilities can include team leader, information architecture engineer, reviewer, editor, technical writer trainer.

rows.name: Reliability
cells: Expected to work effectively under supervision
Expected to write documentation without direct supervision
Expected to be self-managing, write documentation without supervision, review and edit his/her work thoroughly
Expected to be self-managing, take technical responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project, work without supervision, review and edit his/her work thoroughly
Expected to be self-managing, take technical responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project, work without supervision, review and edit his/her work thoroughly

rows.name: Quality
cells: Work should have no spelling and grammatical errors
Must show a sense of responsibility for the quality of the deliverables created by him/her
Creates deliverables in good quality
Must be a role model for colleagues; creates deliverables in high quality
Must be a role model for colleagues, on a par with the best industry standards; creates deliverables in excellent quality

rows.name: Customer Relations
cells: Not expected to deal directly with customers
Not expected to deal directly with customers
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; visit customers with supervision
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentation; visit customers without supervision

Expected to be on a par with the best industry experts in customer relationship skills; participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision

rows.name: Language Level in the Customer’s Communication Language
cells: Able to read and write the Customer’s Communication Language and have advanced speaking ability
Able to read and write the Customer’s Communication Language and have advanced speaking ability
Comfortably able to read, write and speak the Customer’s Communication Language; able to write high-quality unambiguous texts
Totally fluent in the spoken and written variants of the Customer’s Communication Language; able to write high-quality unambiguous texts
Totally fluent in the spoken and written variants of the Customer’s Communication Language; able to write high-quality unambiguous texts
